channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What happens next in Venezuela? The regime’s foundation remains in place even after U.S. capture of Maduro, analyst says
item.description: "So removing Maduro did not necessarily change the fundamental equation of control."

item.title: Managers of Swiss Bar Are Suspected of Negligence in Deadly Fire, Police Say
item.description: Swiss authorities say the fire was probably sparked by small fireworks on champagne bottles that ignited foam insulation on the bar’s basement ceiling...

item.title: Diane Crump, First Woman to Ride in Kentucky Derby, Dies at 77
item.description: She was the first professional female jockey to compete at a track in the United States where betting was legal, and notched up 228 career victories.

item.title: The Trump Administration Approved a Big Lithium Mine. A Top Official’s Husband Profited.
item.description: Karen Budd-Falen, the No. 3 at the Interior Department, didn’t disclose a $3.5 million water-rights contract between her husband and the developers of...

item.title: Trump has been laying the groundwork for a strike on Venezuela for a full year. Here’s the timeline

item.title: Why Security Guarantees Are So Crucial, and Thorny, for Ukraine

item.title: You probably use the same password for 30 different websites. It’s time for a passkey.
item.description: Many companies think of passkeys as just a security upgrade, but they’re really a crucial user experience initiative.

item.title: Nicolas Maduro rose from bus driver to president before presiding over Venezuela’s economic collapse
item.description: In 1986, Maduro traveled to Cuba for a year of ideological instruction, his only formal education after high school. He quickly became a union leader.

item.title: French tourists didn’t believe the young guy on the subway was New York City’s new mayor, so he held up the newspaper to prove it
item.description: Zohran Mamdani also has to move to the mayor's mansion on the Upper East Side before the lease in Queens apartment ends later this month.

item.title: Vance Justifies Capture as Bringing Maduro to Justice
item.description: Mr. Maduro has “multiple indictments in the United States for narcoterrorism,” the vice president said.
